title: Celtics sold for record $6.1 billion, sources say
content: Bill Chisholm has agreed to purchase the Boston Celtics from the Grousbeck family for a valuation for $6.1 billion, sources told ESPN.

title: Spurs' Mamukelashvili makes history in 19 minutes
content: With good friend Flavor Flav hyping a crowd that gleefully flooded Frost Bank Center with MVP chants, Spurs forward Sandro Mamukelashvili scored a career-high 34 points, the most in NBA history when playing fewer than 20 minutes.

title: WR Moore catches on with Vikes after missing '24
content: Wide receiver/returner Rondale Moore, who missed the entire 2024 season with the Falcons because of a knee injury, has reached a deal with the Vikings.

title: Games eye L.A. 'rebirth,' Kendrick Lamar role
content: After deadly fires devastated much of Los Angeles, organizers of the 2028 Games told the IOC how the city will rebuild with their help.

title: Reports: Stanford coach bullied athletics staff
content: Troy Taylor remains on the job. In a statement released by Stanford, he said he had received counseling on "how I interact with others."

title: Source: Texans extend Hunter with $35.6M deal
content: Defensive end Danielle Hunter and the Texans have agreed to a one-year, $35.6 million contract extension, a source told ESPN, confirming an NFL Network report.

title: Coaches laud debut of women's tourney payouts
content: For the first time in 2025, women's teams at the NCAA tournament are getting an individual share of the profits, a perk men's teams have enjoyed for years.

title: Xavier applauds fans for big lift in rally vs. UT
content: Xavier erased a 13-point deficit in its biggest comeback win this season to beat Texas and advance to play Illinois on Friday night in a Midwest Region game at Milwaukee.

title: The blessing and curse of UCLA's Lauren Betts' 6-7 height
content: Lauren Betts was called an alien, a giraffe. Now she's ready to dominate -- not for the bullies, for herself -- as UCLA goes for its first NCAA title.

title: Debating free agency: Which teams improved the most over the past two weeks?
content: We asked 10 experts to weigh in on the most improved teams, top bargains and head-scratching decisions.

title: NHL playoff watch: How the West's second wild-card spot will be won
content: The Canucks-Blues showdown on Thursday (7:30 p.m. ET on ESPN+) could swing the race. Plus, full playoff projections, draft lottery standings and more.

title: Short an ace? In a loaded AL East? Here's why the Orioles think they can win anyway
content: Their window is wide-open, but they're 0-5 in October the past two seasons. Are they wasting an opportunity -- or is this their year?

title: What to watch for in March internationals: Tuchel's England debut, Ronaldo goals, Poch's first big U.S. test
content: It's the first internationals of the year! There's lots happening as World Cup qualifying ramps up and European teams face off in the Nations League.

title: New women's 7 vs. 7 league touting $5M purses
content: A new global 7-versus-7 women's soccer event is set to launch ahead of the UEFA Women's Champions League final in May with the promise of a $5 million prize pool per event.

title: Andy Robertson: Liverpool career far from over
content: Andrew Robertson has brushed off criticism of his Liverpool performances this season and insisted that his time at Anfield is not coming to an end.

title: Mbappé accepts past mistakes as France captain
content: Kylian Mbappé returns to lead France against Croatia after a six-month absence and on Wednesday criticized himself over how he handled the captaincy before.

title: Source: Amorim to make call on Sancho future
content: Manchester United will let Ruben Amorim decide Jadon Sancho's future in the unlikely event that the England forward returns to Old Trafford, a source has told ESPN.

title: McKennie: U.S. needs 'nastiness' in CNL defense
content: United States midfielder Weston McKennie said it's "about time" that the U.S. brings some "nastiness" to its game ahead of Thursday's Concacaf Nations League semifinal against Panama.

title: Chelsea ink Sporting pair, deals worth up to €74M
content: Chelsea have reached an agreement to sign Sporting Lisbon's Geovany Quenda and Dario Essugo in a joint deal worth up to €74.4 million ($81.15 million), the Portuguese side confirmed on Wednesday.

title: Ex-Utd defender Jones 'embarrassed' by injuries
content: Former Manchester United defender Phil Jones has said he was "embarrassed" by the injuries that blighted his Old Trafford career.

title: Martinez joins Messi, out for World Cup qualifiers
content: Argentina striker Lautaro Martinez will miss their upcoming World Cup qualifiers against Uruguay and Brazil due to a hamstring injury, the Argentine FA said on Wednesday.

title: Can South Carolina run it back? Will UConn end title drought? ESPN experts predict Final Four, national champ
content: Which team will cut down the nets in Tampa? ESPN's experts pick the Final Four, the title game matchup and 2025 champion.

title: Nine potential busts to avoid in 2025
content: Who does Tristan H. Cockcroft think will underachieve in 2025? We have nine names to steer clear of when drafting your rosters.

title: Astros pay homage to city's space history with second City Connect threads
content: Featuring "Stros" on the front of the jersey marks the organization's first official use of the fan-driven moniker.

title: Scheffler stays true to roots with Masters menu
content: From cowboy ribeye to chili, the Texas native and two-time Augusta winner left his mark for the champions dinner.

title: NCAA Wrestling Championships: Schedule, rules, scoring, stats
content: The NCAA men's Division I wrestling championships start Thursday; here's how to watch Penn State, Iowa and more.

title: López, Dumornay, Shaw lead best U21 women's soccer players
content: Welcome to the next generation of women's stars aged 21 or under, with representatives from the NWSL, WSL and across Europe.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United prepare €48m offer for Nmecha
content: Manchester United have identified Borussia Dortmund midfielder Felix Nmecha as a key target. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Australia overreactions: McLaren unbeatable, Hamilton's Ferrari regret
content: With the first race of the 2025 F1 season now in the history books, ESPN overreacts to the biggest storylines that came to the fore in Melbourne.

title: UP Professor, Accused Of Raping Students, Arrested After 72 Hours On The Run
content: Police in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj have arrested a 50-year-old Geography professor accused of sexually abusing his students - he allegedly filmed these acts and used these 59 videos to blackmail them.

title: "Attempt To Malign...": Aaditya Thackeray On Disha Salian's Father's Plea
content: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray on Friday rubbished calls for a police case to be filed against him, and an inquiry to be conducted by the CBI, over the death by suicide of celebrity manager Disha Salian at her flat in Mumbai in June 2020.

title: "Unfounded": Air India Responds To Lisa Ray's "No Empathy" Allegation
content: Air India has responded to allegations by actor Lisa Ray that the Tata Group airline did not show empathy for her unwell father as "unfounded".

title: "Social Media Platforms Should Follow Law": Sources After X Sues Centre
content: The government will follow due process and social media platforms must follow the law, sources have said after Elon Musk-owned social media giant X sued the Centre, accusing it of misusing Information Technology laws

title: "No Sympathy For Sunita Williams Because...": Neil deGrasse Tyson Exclusive
content: Plastic cups and time to readjust to Earth's gravity - that is what Sunita Williams, whose eight-day mission to the International Space Station extended to a nine-month stay, will need to recover, astrophysicist Neil deGrasse Tyson told NDTV.

title: Law Doesn't Promote Idleness: Court On Interim Maintenance For Capable Women
content: The Delhi High Court has observed that the law doesn't promote idling and said qualified women with an earning capacity shouldn't claim interim maintenance from their husbands.

title: "Papa Drum Mein Hain," Murdered Meerut Man's Daughter, 6, Told Neighbours
content: The six-year-old daughter of Saurabh Rajput, allegedly murdered by his wife Muskaan Rastogi and her lover Sahil Shukla, kept telling neighbours, "Papa drum mein hai", Saurabh's mother Renu Devi has said

title: 10,152 Indians Imprisoned In Foreign Jails. Highest In This Country
content: As of now, there are 10,152 Indian prisoners, including undertrials, in foreign jails. The government has emphasised its commitment to ensuring the safety, security, and well-being of Indian nationals in foreign countries.

title: Jaipur Woman, Lover Kill Husband. CCTV Shows Them Carrying Body On Bike
content: A couple on a bike, the woman riding pillion with a large bundle in her arms - a seemingly innocuous security video from Rajasthan's Jaipur has gone viral after the white bundle turned out to be a body.

title: "Regret Moving Out Of Noida": Corporate Employee Lists Issues With Bengaluru
content: Bengaluru, the Silicon Valley of India, continues to attract IT professionals from across the country. But not everyone finds the city a perfect fit.

title: Finland Is World's Happiest Country For 8th Year, India Stands At...
content: Released on the UN's International Day of Happiness, the report assesses the quality of life in over 140 countries based on resident feedback.

title: Chahal-Dhanashree Divorce Granted By Court: "No Longer Husband And Wife"
content: Yuzvendra Chahal and Dhanashree Verma had filed a divorce plea in a family court on February 5 this year.

title: Opinion: Why New Zealand Wants Better Ties With India - Despite China
content: New Zealand has been cautious in aligning with security mechanisms that could antagonise Beijing. But it has signalled a desire to balance its economic and security interests in a changing regional order.

title: "Cancel Their Central Contract": Rizwan, Babar Blasted In Explosive Rant
content: Former Pakistan cricket team fast bowler Sikander Bakht blasted Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan for not participating in the National T20 Cup which is organised by the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB).

title: French Scientist Denied Entry To US Over Phone Texts Critical Of Trump
content: The incident unfolded on March 9, when the French space researcher was barred from entering the United States upon arrival in Texas/

title: What Is Dark Energy? The Mystery Behind The Expanding Universe
content: Dark energy makes up roughly 70 percent of the universe, yet we know nothing about it. Around 25 percent of the universe is the equally mysterious dark matter, leaving just five percent for everything that we can see and touch.

title: BJP legislators demand West Bengal Speaker’s resignation over Baruipur violence
content: The BJP MLAs waved black flags at the Speaker inside the State Assembly blaming him for the violence at the LOP Suvendu Adhikari convoy on Wednesday

title: CPI(M) to stage protest on March 25 seeking exclusive ITDA for Srikakulam district
content: The one at Sithampet has gone under the purview of the Parvatipuram-Manyam district, and an exclusive ITDA will help in reaching out to more than two lakh tribal people in the district, says Govinda Rao

title: No communal angle behind attack on APSRTC conductor, say police
content: Police warns of action against those trying to spread hatred among communities by making provocative comments on the incident that happened on the night of March 16

title: Pathanamthitta district panchayat Budget prioritises sanitation and agriculture
content: While a sum of ₹10.3 crore has been earmarked for sanitation, ₹7.16 crore is set aside for agriculture. The Budget estimates a total revenue of ₹129.57 crore against an expenditure of ₹124.36 crore, resulting in a surplus of ₹5.21 crore

title: Steps under way to address drinking water shortage in Kochi, says Kerala Water Resources Minister
content: The government has allocated ₹2,511 crore for modernising water supply schemes in Kochi and Thiruvananthapuram, says the Minister

title: Introduce Kokborok language in education, Tribal groups demand in Tripura
content: The striking Tribal students’ bodies have said that they will blockade national highways and railways, to demand the introduction of the indigenous Kokborok language as part of the syllabus

title: Skin specialists flag widespread quackery in Kerala
content: Dental surgeons, practitioners of Ayurveda, homoeopathy, naturopathy, and Unani, beauty parlour staff with only elementary education, and those holding unrecognised or overseas degrees are reportedly treating patients

title: Sub-classification will ensure justice to all SC sub-castes, says Parvatipuram MLA
content: The government’s decision is in line with the Supreme Court ruling, Vijaya Chandra says, and thanks Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu for implementing the apex court order in letter and spirit

title: Govt. constrained by legal issues in promoting CIs as DSPs: Home Minister Anitha
content: Recruitment of police constables to fill 10,762 posts is under active consideration of the government, she says

title: Ahead of SC judges’ Manipur visit, MTFD asks for ‘tribal point of view’ to be considered in agenda
content: The MTFD has also sought a meeting of the judges with tribal leaders ‘separate from all other persons/authorities’ if possible

title: Drug trafficking: inter-State buses to be brought under aggressive flash inspections
content: Squads given instruction to carry out simultaneous checks in multiple locations and inspect the luggage of passengers in long distance buses

title: KMC targets 100 per cent collection of taxes
content: The collection of property tax till Thursday has been satisfactory, with the officials managing to collect 62 per cent of the target, but the water and trade licence fee collections has been less than 45 per cent

title: UDF members boycott Ministers’ replies citing frequent interruptions by LDF members
content: Speaker tried to dissuade UDF members saying that the demands for grants were on important issues. Ministers replied to the discussions in the absence of the Opposition

title: Agitations ensue after Bengal health department transfers doctor involved with R.G. Kar protests
content: Health department sources describe the transfer as ‘routine’; Subarna Goswami claims it is a ‘vindictive step by the administration’ for his vocal demands for justice for the R.G. Kar rape victim and other criticism against the government

title: Leave the sea shells, save the shores: Why Visakhapatnam’s marine ecosystem needs them
content: A guided walk at Rushikonda Beach, organised by WWF India and the East Coast Conservation Team, highlights the ecological importance of sea shells and why they should remain in their natural habitat

title: After the birds park, adventure sports centre is next on the list in Tiruchi
content: The process of identifying land for the adventure sports centre was on and the departments and nodal agency for executing the project is likely to be finalised soon

title: NSU hailed for becoming central hub for preservation of Sanskrit language
content: Padma Shri V.R. Panchamukhi praises the university for maintaining the ancient language while integrating modern scientific principles and contributing to Indian intellectual heritage through its excellent programmes

title: Kathakala, a 24-hour online storytelling marathon to mark World Storytelling Day
content: A 24-hour online Telugu storytelling marathon will be held from March 22 to 23 featuring more than 100 participants across the world

title: Call to open new police station at Puthuppadi
content: Memorandum submitted to Chief Minister seeking bifurcation of Thamarassery police station and upgrading of existing police aid post at Adivaram

title: Rubber farmers cheer rising market trend but anxious over subsidy distribution
content: With hardly two weeks left for the current financial year to end, farmers worry subsidy distribution may remain incomplete

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Obesity and diabetes management drug launched in India by American pharma company Eli Lilly
content: The market for anti-obesity drugs in India has seen exponential growth, swelling from ₹137 crore in November 2020 to ₹535 crore in November 2024

title: Two anti-farmer parties have joined hands, says Congress, berating AAP and BJP governments’ action against farmers
content: The forcible detention of senior farmer leaders Jagjit Singh Dallewal and Sarwan Singh Pandher by the Punjab Police could not be condemned enough, Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge said

title: Adequate stocks of seeds and fertilizers available for kuruvai, says Mayiladuthurai Collector
content: About 440 tonnes of seeds kept ready for distribution among farmers at 50% subsidy for the 2025-26 kuruvai season in Mayiladuthurai district, says the Collector

title: Forest department builds water troughs in Perambalur reserve forests to help birds, animals quench their thirst
content: New troughs created inside the reserve forests in Perambalur and Veppanthattai forest ranges in addition to the existing structures which are being cleaned and repaired

title: Rail users welcome announcement of Charlapalli to Kanniyakumari weekly express
content: A team of Thanjavur District Rail Users’ Association accompanied by Tamil Nadu BJP State General Secretary Karuppu M. Muruganantham had called on Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw

title: Karnataka Home Minister promises high-level probe into Minister K.N. Rajanna’s allegation of at least 48 persons, including MLAs, being honey-trapped
content: BJP member Basanagouda Patil Yatnal alleged that there is speculation that the Minister too had been honey-trapped

title: Woman from Hyderabad loses ₹2.19 lakh in a credit card scam
content: The victim was tricked into revealing her card details following which she found unauthorised transactions and immediately lodged a complaint

title: Elderly woman loses ₹20 crore to 'digital arrest' fraud; 3 held
content: One of the fraudsters posed as a 'CBI officer' to extort money from the woman adding three persons have been arrested in connection with the crime which took place between December 26, 2024 and March 3 this year

title: HDK seeks Gadkari’s nod for revised cost of ₹900 crore for Mandya Ring Road project
content: Union Minister H.D. Kumaraswamy requests Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari to clear revised cost for project as the work benefits Mandya city’s growth and development

title: Attempt to malign me, will reply to allegations in court: Aaditya on Disha Salian case
content: The petition by Disha Salian’s father claimed that his daughter was raped and murdered, and subsequently, there was a politically-orchestrated cover-up to protect certain influential persons

title: INCOIS scientists unravel genesis behind devastating Cyclone Tauktae
content: Senior scientist R. Harikumar and his research scholar G.G. Zahid have deduced that the cyclonic intensification is because of intense heating prevailing in the atmosphere and also in the land, marginally more than the ocean.

title: No windfall tax on oil companies after new law, says Hardeep Singh Puri
content: Parliament has passed the Oilfields (Regulation and Development) Bill, 2024 that provides policy stability to investors, decriminalises provisions and promotes ease of doing business

title: Erode history-sheeter murder: Two more surrender in court, five detained for questioning
content: John alias Chanakya, 35, of Kitchipalayam in Salem city, was hacked to death by a four-member gang on the highway in front of his wife Saranya while they were travelling by car from Salem to Tiruppur.

title: Over 1,000 cases detected in Tiruchi district during 100-day TB elimination drive
content: Sources said 3,10,753 people in vulnerable sections of society were screened during the campaign in Tiruchi district, out of a mapped population of 3,29,497 as part of a nation-wide campaign

title: Tamil Nadu’s finances show signs of improvement
content: The share of capital expenditure in net public debt or net borrowings is on the rise, despite a substantial amount of borrowings still being used to finance revenue expenditure

title: CM Fadnavis meets Bill Gates, discusses use of AI in agriculture, health
content: Bill Gates, currently on a visit to the country, met Prime Minister Narendra Modi and other Union ministers in Delhi earlier this week

title: When and where of 72nd Miss World Beauty Pageant in Telangana
content: The 25-day long event would be organised at 12 locations in the city and some more in Warangal, Nalgonda, Yadadri Bhuvanagiri

title: Three days after violence, curfew lifted, relaxed in parts of Nagpur
content: Considering the people's convenience and law and order, Commissioner of Police Ravinder Singal ordered the lifting of curfew from Nandanvan and Kapil Nagar police station areas from 2 p.m. on March 22

title: Congress stages 'Kumbhakaran' protest to wake up 'sleeping' BJP government in M.P.
content: During the protest led by Leader of Opposition Umang Singhar in front of the statue of Mahatma Gandhi in the legislature complex premises, MLAs played the flute to wake up Kumbhakaran

title: South Indian women bodybuilders flex in London-based Keerthana Kunnath’s award-winning photographs
content: The photographer, originally from Kozhikode, Kerala, has won the International Photography Exhibition Awards by the Royal Photographic Society in the Under 30s category for her photo-series, ‘Not What You Saw’

title: IPL KKR vs LSG match shifted from Kolkata to Guwahati due to security concerns
content: Kolkata Knight Riders' home IPL match against Lucknow Super Giants on April 6 will be relocated to Guwahati due to security concerns linked to 'Ram Navami' celebrations in Kolkata. Cricket Association of Bengal president Snehasish Ganguly has confirmed the rescheduling after BJP announced extensive processions in the city. The highly anticipated clash between KKR and LSG, owned by RPSG Group chairman Sanjiv Goenka, was expected to attract a packed stadium, with both teams enjoying strong local support.

title: Elon Musk's X sues Centre for using IT Act to 'block' content
content: Elon Musk's X filed a lawsuit against the Indian government for allegedly misusing the IT Act to block content on the platform. The case challenges the interpretation of Section 79(3)(b), claiming it leads to arbitrary censorship and violates Supreme Court rulings. X seeks clearer guidelines and a proper judicial process for content blocking.

title: IPL 2025 rules: What has changed and what has remained the same
content: IPL 2025 will see the reintroduction of saliva on the ball and a new 'Second Ball' rule to mitigate dew effects. The Impact Player rule remains, and DRS will now cover height-based no-balls and off-side wides. BCCI’s updates aim to enhance match excitement and maintain fairness in gameplay. TimesofIndia.com takes a look at the key updates.

title: 'Forced conversions': Minorities facing persecution in Pak, says govt
content: The Union government told Parliament there have been reports of violence and discrimination against minority communities, including Hindus, in Pakistan. Many Hindus are reportedly migrating from Sindh province due to intimidation, abduction, forced conversions and forced marriages. Hindu migrants in India can apply for Long Term Visas and seek permanent settlement and Indian citizenship.

title: Amazon layoffs: When CEO Andy Jassy said he wants fewer managers because ...
content: Amazon is reportedly cutting 14,000 jobs, although the company has not officially confirmed this figure. CEO Andy Jassy is pushing for a flatter company structure by reducing middle management. Despite employee backlash, Amazon is also enforcing a strict five-day return-to-office policy to strengthen company culture.

title: Why dark energy is losing its force
content: Recently, two major research groups—the Dark Energy Spectroscopic Instrument (DESI) and the Dark Energy Survey (DES)—have collected massive amounts of data by observing millions of galaxies. Their findings suggest that dark energy is not constant; instead, it appears to be losing strength over time.

title: Facing dragon’s fire, Manila turns to Delhi: Philippines wants India to join ‘squad’
content: The Philippines is urging India to join the US, Australia, and Japan in the 'Squad' alliance to counter China's territorial expansion in the South China Sea. Amid concerns over China's coercive tactics, military officials discussed bolstering maritime security in the Indo-Pacific during the Raisina Dialogue.

title: Ben Stiller, Paul McCartney, 400-plus stars urge US to act against Google, OpenAI
content: Over 400 Hollywood celebrities, including Ben Stiller and Paul McCartney, oppose OpenAI and Google's attempts to relax copyright laws for AI training. They assert that such changes threaten the entertainment industry, which supports millions of jobs and significant wages annually, emphasizing the broader impact on America's cultural and knowledge sectors.

title: Woman kills husband with lover in Rajasthan, sets body on fire
content: A 42-year-old woman and her 30-year-old lover have been arrested for allegedly murdering her husband and setting his body on fire in Jaipur. The perpetrators conspired to kill the victim, a vegetable vendor, and burned his body in a forest area, attempting to cover their tracks.

title: Kolkata techie jumps to death from office building
content: A senior manager at an Indo-American IT company, Dwaipayan Bhattacharjee, died by suicide after jumping from the 6th-floor refuge area of his Kolkata office. Police investigations revealed he was battling depression and under medication. CCTV footage and his gadgets are being reviewed to understand the circumstances.

title: Heart health matters: Join TOI's Medithon for expert insights
content: Heart diseases are becoming more prevalent due to lifestyle choices and genetic factors. Prevention through healthy habits, regular check-ups, and awareness is crucial. The Times of India will host a medithon on March 21 with top cardiologists discussing heart disease risks and prevention. Sessions will cover managing heart diseases and specific impacts on youngsters and women.

title: Elon Musk’s xAI acquires AI video startup HotShot; CEO says ‘We are ...launch’
content: Elon Musk's xAI company has acquired New York-based HotShot, a startup specializing in AI-powered video generation tools. This move is set to enhance xAI’s generative AI capabilities and integrate HotShot's technology into xAI's Grok chatbot platform, with potential developments like the 'Grok Video' model on the horizon.

title: When Shoaib Malik's sister didn't attend his second wedding with Sana Javed
content: Shoaib Malik's sisters reveal his family didn’t attend his nikah, hinting at the reasons behind his divorce from Sania Mirza. Sania's family confirms the separation, addressing concerns related to Shoaib's alleged extramarital affairs. Shoaib's nikah with Sana Javed is confirmed through his Instagram post.

title: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney to call snap election on April 28: Reports
content: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney is expected to call a snap election with voting likely on April 28. The campaign will focus on escalating trade tensions with the U.S. and President Trump's rhetoric. Carney aims to protect Canadian workers and strengthen global alliances.

title: What is Indian-origin Badar Khan Suri's alleged connection to Hamas?
content: Badar Khan Suri's petition said he had no criminal record and had not been charged with a crime. His wife Mapheze Saleh was the reason Suri was targeted, the petition said adding that Saleh allegedly had ties with Hamas and once worked for Al Jazeera. Saleh's father Ahmed Yousef was reportedly a senior political adviser to the Hamas leadership. A Wikipedia page on Ahmed Yousef described him as the disciple of the founder of Hamas, Sheikh Ahmed Yasin. It describes Yousef as Hamas' gate to the West because of his years of living in the US.

title: Ennore oil spill: NGT grants interim stay on ₹73-crore compensation imposed on CPCL
content: The compensation, which includes ₹38.24 crore for environmental damage and ₹35.43 crore for socio-economic impact, was levied by the TNPCB, which estimated that 517 tonnes of oil was spilled from the refinery

title: Watch: Salem auto driver creates ‘natural AC’ in vehicle to beat scorching summer heat
content: Subramaniam has installed a canopy made of corn stalks, hay, and a sprinkler system that showers water onto the roof

title: 50 journalists died due to Covid in Odisha: CM
content: In another reply, Mr. Majhi informed that 14 working journalists were attacked during the last five years in Odisha

title: MVA leaders meet Governor; complain about ‘bias’ of Assembly speaker, council chairman
content: The leaders in Maharashtra accuse presiding officers of “bias”, meet Governor to submit memorandum on legislative proceedings

title: 45 projects underway, 73 more identified for conservation of heritage sites in J&K: Omar Abdullah
content: Mr. Abdullah mentioned that no heritage conservation projects sanctioned by the central government are currently being executed by the Department of Culture or the Department of Tourism in Jammu and Kashmir

title: Discordant voices within Malayalam film industry over producers’ association publishing partial collection figures
content: Some filmmakers and producers point at ‘unfairness’ of putting out partial collection figures as the association has published just producers’ share from Kerala theatres after excluding overseas revenues, OTT revenues and exhibitors’ share

title: CPI-M leaders protest against forcible collection of taxes in Nellore
content: Nellore Municipal Commissioner Surya Teja has directed the staff to attach the properties of those who have long pending dues

title: Bengaluru to get relief from summer sun, IMD predicts light rain on March 22 and 23
content: Light rain and thundershowers are likely to occur at isolated places of Bengaluru Urban and neighbouring districts, accordign to the IMD.

title: No vendetta politics in land-grabbing case of H.D. Kumaraswamy, says Karnataka Deputy CM D.K. Shivakumar
content: Says officials following orders of High Court of Karnataka with regard to alleged encroachment of close to 18 acres by Union Minister for Heavy Industries H.D. Kumaraswamy and his family members

title: Supreme Court raps lawyer for using 'consensual relationship' in bail plea of client booked for minor's rape
content: The Bench wanted to set the fact straight with the lawyer that consent was immaterial if the survivor was a minor

title: Amazon, Flipkart warehouses in T.N. searched as BIS cracks down on non-certified products
content: It was found that some products were stored and sold without the ISI mark, though they were covered under the BIS mandatory certification

title: 30 Maoists killed in twin Bastar encounters
content: 26 were gunned down along the Bijapur-Dantewada border while four were killed on Kanker-Narayanpur border of north Bastar

title: Meerut murder: Lawyers beat up Muskan, her lover
content: A woman and her lover were remanded to judicial custody after being accused of murdering her Merchant Navy officer husband, dismembering his body, and concealing it in cement. The couple confessed and were assaulted by lawyers during a court hearing in Meerut.

title: J&K BJP leader and ex-MLA shoots himself dead
content: BJP leader and former independent MLA Faqir Mohammad Khan from Jammu and Kashmir's Gurez died by suicide on Thursday. He was found dead inside the Tulsibagh government quarters in Srinagar. Chief Minister Omar Abdullah and other officials expressed condolences. Khan, who joined the BJP in 2020, contested unsuccessfully in last year's assembly elections.

title: How Eddie Jordan, Michael Schumacher’s first boss was banned from visiting him
content: Eddie Jordan, who passed away at 76, was instrumental in Michael Schumacher's legendary Formula One career. In 1991, he gave Schumacher his debut at the Belgian Grand Prix. Despite losing Schumacher to Benetton, their friendship endured. Jordan respected the Schumacher family's privacy after Michael's 2013 accident, acknowledging the immense strain on his wife, Corinna.

title: Ozempic-like weight loss drug Mounjaro launched in India - Details
content: Eli Lilly has launched Mounjaro in India, a new once-weekly injectable drug for type 2 diabetes and weight management. Approved by CDSCO, it targets GIP and GLP-1 receptors, aiming to improve blood sugar control and aid in weight loss. Clinical trials showed significant results, underlining its potential in treating diabetes and obesity.

title: Ex-NHL coach blasts New York Rangers’ playoff chances, calls out team for horrific performance
content: The New York Rangers struggled in their 2-1 loss to the Calgary Flames, generating only 13 shots and showing low urgency. Coach Peter Laviolette acknowledged the lack of effort, while former NHL figures criticized the team's trades and performance. With their playoff spot at risk, the Rangers must quickly improve their competitiveness.

title: Why Trump cannot make Americans happy
content: A loneliness epidemic is gripping the country, particularly among young adults, with one in five reporting they have no close friends. More Americans are dining alone, living alone, and spending less time engaging in meaningful social interactions. Political polarisation is at an all-time high, creating two completely separate realities, where people see opposing views as existential threats. Perhaps most alarming, deaths of despair—suicides, drug overdoses, and alcohol-related deaths—are still rising in the US, even as they decline in other countries. The most disillusioned group isn’t Trump or Biden supporters but abstainers—those who don’t vote at all—who report the lowest levels of happiness and the highest levels of alienation. Simply put, America is becoming wealthier but lonelier, more divided, and more distrustful—a toxic combination that keeps dragging national happiness down.

title: Daggubati, Devarakonda, other actors booked for promoting betting apps
content: Prominent Tollywood actors, including Rana Daggubati and Prakash Raj, among others, face charges for promoting online betting apps, as per a complaint from a local resident. The police have intensified efforts to curb this issue, launching an online awareness campaign #SayNoToBettingApps to educate the public about the dangers of online betting.

title: 'Yuzvendra Chahal, Dhanashree are no longer husband and wife'
content: Yuzvendra Chahal's divorce from Dhanashree Verma has been finalised, with the court accepting their joint petition. The couple, who married in December 2020, had been living separately for over two years. The Bombay High Court expedited the process considering Chahal's IPL commitments. Dhanashree is notable for her dance performances. Dhanashree and Chahal got engaged in 2020 and tied the knot in December of the same year in a private ceremony in Gurugram.

title: What is the 'Second Ball' rule in IPL 2025? All you need to know
content: The IPL 2025 introduces the 'Second Ball' rule to counter the impact of dew in night matches, ensuring fair play for bowlers. Additionally, the BCCI lifts the saliva ban, making the IPL the first major cricket tournament to reintroduce saliva use after the COVID-19 pandemic. Under this rule, on-field umpires will assess the condition of the ball after the 11th over of the second innings. If excessive dew is detected, the bowling team will be permitted to use a new ball.

title: Oops, he does it again! Nitish loses cool, this time over mobile phones
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar demanded a ban on mobile phones in the assembly, criticizing their use by legislators during sessions. This led to a heated exchange with opposition leaders, who accused him of being anti-technology and outdated. Kumar's criticisms also extended to the previous governments led by Rabri Devi and her husband, Lalu Yadav.

title: Meerut: How wife lured lover to murder ex-merchant navy officer
content: Saurabh Rajput was murdered by his wife Muskan and her accomplice Sahil after returning from London to celebrate her birthday in Meerut. Muskan had manipulated Sahil by exploiting his grief and orchestrating the murder for months. Her parents have demanded the death penalty for her.

title: Top reasons stock markets rallied today
content: Stock market today: BSE Sensex and Nifty50, the Indian equity benchmark indices, rallied strongly in trade on Thursday. While BSE Sensex rose around 1,000 points intraday, Nifty50 crossed the 23,200 mark.

title: New Zealand PM Christopher Luxon plays cricket at Mumbai’s Wankhede Stadium
content: New Zealand Prime Minister Christopher Luxon visited Mumbai's Wankhede Stadium, engaging with Kiwi cricketers Ajaz Patel, Ross Taylor, and Trent Boult. Luxon celebrated India-New Zealand cricketing ties and Patel's historic ten-wicket feat at the stadium. During his official visit, Luxon played cricket with children in Delhi, strengthening the bond between the two nations.

title: Former CSK star brutally mocks RCB - WATCH
content: The 18th edition of the Indian Premier League (IPL) starts on March 22, 2025, with defending champions Kolkata Knight Riders facing Royal Challengers Bengaluru. Former CSK player Subramaniam Badrinath recently mocked RCB on Instagram. AB de Villiers highlighted the tough challenges of winning the IPL and expressed hope that RCB, led by Virat Kohli, will claim the trophy this season.

title: Air India may place order for 30-40 new wide-body jets from Airbus, Boeing: Report
content: Air India is in discussions to order 30 to 40 wide-body aircraft, including Airbus A350 and Boeing 777X models, potentially exceeding 50. The move is part of their transformation under Tata Group ownership.

title: After divorce, Chahal's T-shirt with cryptic words goes viral
content: Yuzvendra Chahal and Dhanashree Verma were granted a divorce by a Mumbai family court. The proceedings were fast-tracked due to Chahal's commitments with the Punjab Kings in IPL 2025. Dhanashree received INR 4.35 crore as alimony, refuting earlier rumours of a higher demand.

title: F1 pandit Eddie Jordan dies of cancer
content: Eddie Jordan, former owner of the Jordan Grand Prix F1 team, passed away at age 76 after battling aggressive cancer. Known for his energy and contributions to motorsports and other ventures, his death was announced with deep sorrow by his family. The Formula 1 community and fans honored his legacy and impact on the sport.

title: Shah declares ‘ruthless approach’ as forces kill 22 Naxalites in Chhattisgarh
content: Union home minister Amit Shah reaffirmed the government's zero-tolerance policy towards Naxalism after security forces killed 22 Naxalites in Chhattisgarh. The operation involved the BSF and DRG units, resulting in 18 casualties in Bijapur and 4 in Kanker. Shah emphasized a ruthless approach against the insurgents, aiming for a Naxal-free India by March 2023.

title: 'Glorifying invaders act of treason': UP CM Yogi amid Aurangzeb row
content: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath labelled endorsing invaders like Aurangzeb as treason, emphasizing respect for India's cultural heritage. His remarks follow the controversy over the Mughal emperor's tomb removal in Maharashtra, amid violent clashes in Nagpur where thirty-three police personnel were injured, and fifty arrests were made.

title: BCCI lifts saliva ban ahead of IPL 2025
content: The BCCI has decided to lift the ban on the use of saliva to shine the ball for the upcoming IPL season after consulting with team captains. This makes IPL the first major cricket event to reintroduce this practice post the COVID-19 pandemic. The decision, made independently of the ICC, has garnered support from the majority of captains.

title: MoS Nityanand Rai’s nephews engage in gunfight over 'minor dispute'; 1 dead
content: A gunfight between two nephews of Union state home minister Nityanand Rai in Bihar's Bhagalpur led to one death and one injury. The incident stemmed from a minor dispute that escalated, with both brothers shooting at each other. Statements are currently being recorded by the police.

title: Who is Badar Khan Suri? Indian researcher in US detained over supporting Palestine
content: Indian academic Badar Khan Suri, researching at Georgetown University, was detained by US immigration authorities. His focus on global conflict zones has raised concerns about political targeting and academic freedom. His arrest follows the detention of another Indian student, heightening scrutiny over international academics in the US.

title: Amazon, Flipkart warehouses raided over non-certificated products
content: BIS officials raided Amazon and Flipkart warehouses in Tiruvallur, seizing uncertified products worth lakhs under Section 17 of the BIS Act, 2016. Authorities confiscated items like insulated flasks and baby diapers, and warned that the offense carries penalties including imprisonment and substantial fines.

title: 'Football runs through my veins': Mamata Banerjee receives signed jersey by Messi
content: West Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee expressed her admiration for football legend Lionel Messi after receiving a jersey autographed by him. She described Messi as an artist with the ball and said the jersey represents Bengal's deep passion for football. Banerjee highlighted how this love for football unites people across Bengal.

title: Shakib Al Hasan cleared of suspect bowling action, ready to bowl again
content: Former Bangladesh captain Shakib Al Hasan has been cleared to resume bowling after passing a reassessment of his action. The veteran all-rounder was suspended last December for an illegal action, which sidelined him from the ICC Champions Trophy. He is now eligible to bowl in ODIs and global leagues. The all-rounder had participated in last year's IPL auction and the PSL draft in January but could not find any takers.

title: Akbar Road signboard defaced in Delhi
content: Three men defaced the 'Akbar Road' signboard in Delhi, claiming retaliation for the alleged vandalism of Maharana Pratap's statue. Amit Rathore and Vijay, linked to the Hindu Rashtra Navnirman Sena, justified the act as a protest against signboards bearing names of historical figures they consider invaders. Further police details are awaited.

title: 'We are not talking about injuries, Rishabh Pant himself ... '
content: Lucknow Super Giants' mentor Zaheer Khan has promised an aggressive and fearless brand of cricket in the upcoming IPL season under new captain Rishabh Pant. Zaheer emphasised Pant's resilience and offensive tactics to lead the team with confidence and hope for a strong performance. Addressing concerns over injuries, Zaheer dismissed any negativity, pointing to Pant's resilience as a key factor in shaping the team's attitude.

title: Heightened security at Shambhu border after farm leaders' arrest; Dallewal shifted
content: Haryana security personnel fortified the Punjab border, detaining farmer leaders to stop their 'Delhi Chalo' march. The police removed protest structures and cleared roads closed for a year. The seventh round of discussions on minimum support price (MSP) laws took place in Chandigarh. Farmers faced heavy barricading upon their return to Punjab, with ongoing support from state officials.

title: Grabbing minor's breasts, breaking her pyjama string doesn't amount to rape: HC
content: The Allahabad High Court has revised charges against two accused in a case involving a minor girl, changing the charges from rape to aggravated sexual assault under the POCSO Act. The court determined the incident didn't constitute an attempt to rape but was still a severe sexual offense.

title: New research suggests dark energy is fading. Could the universe reverse course?
content: Recent research from the dark energy spectroscopic instrument (Desi) team indicates that dark energy, which drives the universe's expansion, is weakening. This significant finding challenges the previous notion of dark energy as a constant force and suggests a possible reversal in universal expansion.

title: Is JuJu Watkins the best player in the women’s NCAA tournament? We rank the top 25
content: it's a time for stars to win the ultimate NCAA tournament . a chance to win their first national championship . the WNBA is a year for stars who don't win the NCAA title . it is the first time a player has won a national championship since march .

title: Dickie V makes his March Madness picks for every game
content: the big dance is here, and I'm ready to break it down, Dickie V style! we've got PTPers (prime time performers), diaper dandies and championship-caliber coaching ready to take the court .

title: Inside MLB's process of authenticating game-used items
content: pitcher Roki Sasaki wears an MLB debut patch on the left sleeve of his jersey . the patch will be embedded into his one-of-one numbered Topps Chrome Update Rookie Debut Patch Autograph Card . it's important for collectors to covet, chase and ultimately pull items that come off the field .

title: White Sox's 'Celebration Cake Shake' leads new MLB park confections
content: baseball teams are becoming more innovative and stepping up their food game in 2025 . the "Celebration Cake Shake" features birthday cake ice cream, confetti cake, a pinwheel cookie and a maraschino cherry . this follows the White Sox's "Campfire Milkshake" from last season .

title: It's bracket time: Make your picks for the men's tournament
content: Welcome back to the #1 men's bracket game! The tourney tips off Thursday, 3/20 @ 12:15p ET - don't get locked out, create your brackets today! Don't forget to create a group and invite your friends to share in the madness.

title: Predicting 10 women's early-round upsets
content: the 2023 women's NCAA tournament produced four upsets . there were five in 2022, the second round gave us one last year and two the year before that . a no. 10 over a No. 7 counts just like a . no. 6 beating a. 3 in the first round .

title: Let the fun begin: Make your picks for the women's tournament
content: Welcome back to the #1 Women's Bracket game! The tourney tips off Friday, 3/21 @ 11:30a ET - don't get locked out, create your brackets today! Be sure to create a group and invite your friends to share in the madness.

title: From Jackrabbits to 'King Triton': March Madness boasts unique mascots
content: the bulldog is one of the most iconic mascots in college sports . some of the world's most memorable ones have the honor of being inducted into the Mascot Hall of Fame . a few schools claim the breed as their mascotts, including Yale , Drake .

title: Way-Too-Early Top 25: Next season's breakout player for every team
content: the 2025 season is on the way and several budding players on our Way-Too-Early Top 25 teams are primed for breakout campaigns . incoming freshman running back Gideon Davidson could give Clemson's offense an immediate jolt .
